issues.description: The problem statement (Part 2) incorrectly says that the PersonController methods take a Consumer<List<Note>> parameter, while both the template and the solution use Consumer<List<Person>>. This is a clear type/parameter mismatch in the problem text (likely a copy-paste typo) and can confuse students about the expected generic type for the callbacks when implementing the client-side PersonController.
issues.suggested_fix: Fix the problem statement text so it consistently references Consumer<List<Person>> for PersonController methods (replace Consumer<List<Note>> with Consumer<List<Person>>). Ensure any other occurrences in the instructions that mix Note/Person types are corrected to avoid confusion.
